intro: Neodissochaeta brassii, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Neodissochaeta brassii is often found in open habitats and is not commonly cultivated for ornamental purposes.
